schema.headline: Met Gala live updates: Doja Cat wears feline prosthetics while Margot Robbie and Dua Lipa stun in vintage Chanel

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Phoebe Bridgers
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Stunning. Also check out the details on the back.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Bathroom pictures inside the Met are always iconic
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: And this year is no different. Presenting, the Kardashian-Jenner edition.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: There was a cockroach at the Met Gala and photographers went bonkers for it
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Sound on to hear someone shouting at Kevin to "GET A PHOTO." Photographer Kevin Mazur poses with his photo of said cockroach... but sadly there wasn't a happy ending.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Jennie from Blackpink
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: This is so sweet! This is the K-pop star's first Met Gala as well. She told Emma Chamberlain she's interested to see how certain celebrities are going to sit down in their outfits later tonight.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: We have a double up
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Director Olivia Wilde wore a similar gown to the Met Gala as Vogue China editor Margaret Zhang. It's an 1983 Chloé look designed by Karl Lagerfeld himself, dubbed "the violin dress." Aide from the colours, there are other differences as well: Margaret's has a fuller skirt with gold detailing along the bottom.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Brooklyn Beckham and Nicola Peltz Beckham
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I know so much about this couple against my will but I am also not complaining.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Why is the Karl Lagerfeld theme for the Met Gala so controversial?
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody:
what was this years theme
 - Peggy. Hi Peggy! This year's event is all about the late fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld. Given his past comments about women's bodies, the #MeToo movement and the Syrian refugee crisis, the event's theme is not without its critics. You can read more in this piece from my colleague Dannielle Maguire .

liveBlogUpdate.headline: We need to talk about Tems!
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: This is amazing. A very late contender for best on ground.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Jessica Chastain
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: The bleached blonde locks and sunglasses are VERY Karl. But I have to admit, I miss her red hair.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Lily Aldridge
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: She's a Met Gala staple. I appreciate the pop of pink.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Olivia Rodrigo
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I'm so glad I found her! I was worried she didn't score an invite. Again, lots more black and white.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Kristen Stewart
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: She looks so young here? I think it's the brown hair.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Karlie Kloss shows off her baby bump
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Exciting times!

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Model Quannah Chasinghorse
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Okay there's been four colours on the carpet today: black, white, red and pink.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: There's been a lot of fanfare for Rihanna, but ASAP Rocky is also making his mark
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Wearing jeans to a formal occasion: truly a man after my own heart.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Kaitlyn Dever
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: This is very sweet. I've seen a lot of Chanel roses tonight, and a lot of red looks, but this is the first time I've seen the two combined so nicely.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Rapper Yung Miami
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: This is what I'm talking about! Give me something exciting. I want you to block out the view from the person sitting behind you during the Met dinner.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Daisy Edgar-Jones
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Oh this is cool. We've seen so many Chanel bows tonight but this is a fun take on the trend.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Let's zoom out on Florence Pugh's look
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Bridget posted an update before on Florence's new shaved cut, but I wanted to zoom out a bit and show you her full look.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: More of Rihanna's Met Gala look
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: And here's the reveal!

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Breaking news: Rihanna has arrived at the Met Gala
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I've been wondering when she was going to arrive! Of course she would make her grand entrance at the last minute.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Indian businesswoman Natasha Poonawalla is reflecting the lights
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Check out this disco-ball inspired look.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Kim Kardashian decked herself out in 50,000 pearls
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: is kim k there if so what is she wearing - Peggy. Hey Peggy! Yep, can confirm Kim Kardashian got an invite and she is wearing 50,000 freshwater pearls, courtesy of Schiaparelli's Daniel Roseberry. According to Vogue, it took a dozen artisans over 1,000 hours of work to complete.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Vanessa Hudgens joins the chain of trains
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: It's a popular look this year, but it's hard to go past that enormous train from Jeremy Pope that we saw a little earlier (complete with Karl and his iconic sunglasses).

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Nicole Kidman, Margot Robbie and Miranda Kerr among Aussies at the Met Gala
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Seeing Nic back in the iconic Chanel dress from the Baz Lurhmann directed commercial is some sweet 00's nostalgia for me. The Aussies are killing it here. - SarahG. It's a fitting throwback! We've seen a few Aussies on the red carpet today, including Margot Robbie and Miranda Kerr.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Check out this awesome vantage point
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: These lucky New Yorkers reside just opposite The Mark Hotel and have been watching the fanfare as the celebrities depart for the Met Gala.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Margot, Dua and Naomi (and Ben Platt!) are your favourites
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Hi Jess and Bridget. I really enjoyed Ben Platt's Mugatu-inspired outfit. - Sharon He's definitely one of the best dressed men tonight! So many amazing looks but my faves are definitely Margot Robbie, Dua Lipa, and Naomi Campbell - R Completely agree with you, I love all three of these ladies!

liveBlogUpdate.headline: The biggest tribute to Karl Lagerfeld yet
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: And when I say biggest, I mean it! Here's Jeremy Pope posing with a huge train, complete with Karl and his iconic sunglasses.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Aubrey Plaza and Stella McCartney arrive at the Met Gala
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Plaza is actually wearing one of McCartney's designs tonight. Speaking to reporters a little earlier on the red carpet, she weighed in on Jared Leto coming as Karl cat Choupette. Plaza: I know about the cat … he took that head off way too soon.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Which looks have been your favourites so far?
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: We've seen plenty of looks already and I'm keen to know your thoughts! Any favourites? Let us know in the comments! Personally, I feel like there's been a lot less drama this year as the theme lends itself to more timeless concepts.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Paris Hilton is en route
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Here she is leaving The Mark Hotel earlier.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: I take back what I said about Janelle Monae's look..
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: In a pretty seamless carpet reveal, the dress has transformed and the jackets are gone.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: The many looks of Cardi B
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: So Cardi B wore this incredible pink look when she left The Mark Hotel earlier. But I was wondering why it took her so long to appear at the actual Met Gala … And as it turns out, she had an outfit change and walked the famous steps of the Met in this black outfit.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Janelle Monae is embracing the 'Queenslanders when it gets below 20 degrees' aesthetic
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Now that's a look I can get behind.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: EGOT winner Viola Davis gives us a much-needed boost of colour
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: This pink is ravishing.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Florence Pugh arrives with a new look and a headpiece to match
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: The actress has revealed she's shaved her head for an upcoming film, telling reporters on the red carpet there was "no better way to release it to the world than at The Met". Florence: I've been keeping it under wraps for about three weeks now … [I'm] very happy to have it here with this look.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Speaking of The Last of Us …
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Here's Bella Ramsey!

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Pedro Pascal! At the Met! In shorts!
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: A lesson in trans-seasonal dressing.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Gigi Hadid arrives at the Met
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Now I'm on the lookout for her sister, Bella.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Business in the front, party at the back
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Rapper and singer Bad Bunny is showing it's all about the angles 👇

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Police detain climate activists
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Quick update from the climate protest happening outside The Mark Hotel where many celebrities get ready ahead of the Met Gala.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Jenna Ortega
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: HUGE Wednesday vibes.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Serena Williams arrives with her husband … and their new plus one 🥰
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Serena Williams has arrived at the Met Gala in a black and white piece by Gucci, and has announced that she and her husband Alexis Ohanian are expecting their second child together. "Was so excited when Anna Wintour invited the 3 of us to the Met Gala," she wrote on Instagram.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Kendall Jenner rounding out the Kardashian camp
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Kendall Jenner being invited was a pretty safe bet considering she was on the cover of Vogue recently which honoured Karl Lagerfeld.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Kim Kardashian arrives at the Met Gala
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: And the rumours about a Kardashian ban have well and truly been put to rest.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Climate activists protest as celebrities leave The Mark Hotel
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Why protest outside The Mark Hotel? Well, it's an exclusive hotel where many celebrities get ready for the Met Gala, so heaps of photgraphers and fans wait around hoping to catch a glimpse. Plus, there's way too much security at the actual Met Gala for the activists to get close to the inside.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Brittney Griner attends Met Gala after release from Russian prison last year
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: The WNBA star was released in a high-level prisoner exchange for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout in December. Griner was detained in February last year after arriving in Russia with vape cartridges filled with "hashish oil", and was later found guilty of drug possession and smuggling. She's among a number of athletes attending tonight's invite-only event, and is there with her wife, Cherelle Griner.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Kylie Jenner has arrived
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Our first Jenner sighting of the night. I actually love this as it's one of the only bold colours on the carpet.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Lily Collins pays tribute to Karl Lagerfeld
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: ... by wearing a train with his name written on it.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: I do my hair toss, check my nails …
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Lizzo has arrived at fashion's biggest night and she's back with the beads. She brought a flute to last year's event and serenaded people on the steps of the Met Gala, so we'll see if we get to hear it again this time around.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Maya Hawke
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: She looks snug as a bug in a rug.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Kendall Roy spotted at the Met
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: The juice is loose, baby! He is taking this so seriously. I love it.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Lil Nas X
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Finally something weird! Took us a bit too long to get here.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Anne Hathaway
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: My GOODNESS. She is mother, as the youths of today would say.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Vanessa Hudgens
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Baby V! I like it.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Kardashians alert! Kim has just arrived
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I'm chasing down HD pictures like my life depends on it. I heard her talking on the red carpet before and she said her daughter (I assume North) is waiting in the car, which is hilarious. Also just spotted Kylie Jenner, but not Kendall (yet).

liveBlogUpdate.headline: You know how I thought Doja Cat might have dressed as Karl's cat?
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Well Jared Leto is definitely dressed as Karl cat Choupette.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Billie Eilish is back in black for this year's Karl Lagerfeld theme
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Last year, Eilish wore a light green and purple Gucci corseted gown to the Met Gala, where the theme was In America: An Anthology of Fashion.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Tom Ford suits up for the Met Gala
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: You'd recognise the name from his self-titled luxury brand, but prior to that he was also the creative director at Gucci and Yves Saint Laurent.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Finally! Some prosthetics at the Met
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Doja Cat is a cat. Is she honouring Karl's cat Choupette? Much to think about.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Anne Hathaway has arrived and I bow down
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: She looks INCREDIBLE. Anne has had such a 'comeback' of sorts due to her amazing styling of late. Miranda Priestly would approve. I'll get us some HD pictures to admire shortly. In this video you can hear her saying her hair stylist used a flower from a Chanel show in the 90s.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Belgian fashion designer Diane von Furstenberg arrives for fashion's biggest night
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: She's here with her husband, Barry Diller, the founder of Fox Broadcasting Company. Von Furstenberg is known for her wrap dress, which you can see on display tonight.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Ashley Graham
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: This is so stunning. No notes.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Sydney Sweeney
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: The It Girl of the moment is here. Is she dating her Anyone But You co-star Glen Powell? Nobody knows, but one thing is for sure: I freaking love this look. The bow in the hair! The bow around the knees! Ugh.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Margot Robbie
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: As I mentioned before, Margot is wearing a dress design originally worn by Cindy Crawford back in 1993.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: The trim, the chain, the tailoring
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Ben Platt has arrived at the Met Gala straight from his audition to become the newest member of Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band. I'm a fan, it's a nice change from the traditional suit.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Amanda Seyfried
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I actually love this a lot, maybe because I'm digging the hair so much.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Anok Yai is another favourite
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I have been wishing and waiting for a stunning full length photo of this look and now I can finally share it. Another favourite of mine from tonight.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Stop everything! Robert Pattinson is here
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I am OBSESSED with this man. Borderline unhinged right now seeing him at the Met Gala. And his girlfriend Suki Waterhouse, singer and star of Daisy Jones and the Six, looks absolutely stunning.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Hugh Jackman and Deborra-Lee Furness have arrived at the Met Gala
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: And they're continuing the trend away from white. It's a good call, black makes it way harder to tell when you've spilled tomato sauce on your outfit.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Margot Robbie was the last Chanel ambassador Karl Lagerfeld picked
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Another Aussie alert! Margot Robbie is here and she's looking gorgeous. I will get us pics ASAP! She's wearing the same dress worn by Cindy Crawford in 1993. "They remade it for me and it's a Karl design so I feel really great in it actually," she said on the red carpet. "Obviously the Met is also an exciting night but I had the great privilege of getting to know Karl to an extent. I was the last Chanel ambassador that he picked, so it's an honour. I'm thrilled they're honouring him tonight.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: It's noice, it's different, it's unusual
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: English model and singer-songwriter Karen Elson has arrived at the Met Gala. Her runway modelling credits include Gucci, Marc Jacobs, Jean-Chanel, Dolce & Gabbana and Versace, among others.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Michaela Coel is currently best on ground
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: One of my favourites from tonight! Michaela wears a Schiaparelli gown adorned with 130,000 crystals.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Catherine Martin and Baz Luhrmann
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: More Aussies! They look so good together.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Gisele Bündchen is also rewearing a Chanel gown
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Everyone is feeling VERY sentimental today. Gisele is wearing 2007 couture bridal gown that she also wore in a Harpers Bazaar Korea issue in 2007.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Let's get to the supermodels
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Kate Moss. Naomi Campbell.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Rita Ora
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Look at that train!

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Here's why Nicole Kidman's dress might look familiar
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: It's the same dress she wore in her 2004 Chanel No. 5 commercial she did with Australian director Baz Luhrmann. "I think my deep, deep love of Karl came from this time together," Nicole said on the Met Gala red carpet. "So to be able to honour him and wear this dress for Chanel, I suppose the way these couture gowns last. If you take care of them and love them, they are timeless."

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Doja Cat en route under the cover of umbrellas
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: You gotta keep the drama under wraps!

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Aussie alert! Our Nicole has arrived
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban are walking the steps of the Megt Gala. I'm working hard to get you a full length shot of Nicole's dress.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Penelope Cruz
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Another co-chair! I'm seeing a lot of white gowns on the carpet this year.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Emma Chamberlain in blue
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I am SUCH a fan of Emma Chamberlain and I'm loving this blue fit.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: How much is a Met Gala ticket?
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: It's not really about how much a ticket costs, because even celebrities can't just buy a ticket. The Met Gala is so exclusive that you have to be invited. Generally companies buy tables. A fashion label would then host its desired celebrities. This year, the cost has gone up, as it does every few years because even the Met isn't immune to inflation: It's now $50,000 for an individual ticket, and tables start at $300,000 .

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Dua Lipa has arrived!
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: She's the first Met Gala co-chair I've spotted tonight. Fans have already clocked she's wearing Chanel Fall/Winter 1992 couture.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Who are this year's Met Gala co-chairs and what do they actually do?
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: This year's five hosts are drawn from television, film, sports and music, including: Emmy-winning writer, actor and producer Michaela Coel Oscar-winning actor Penélope Cruz, who has worked with Chanel for more than 20 years recently retired tennis superstar Roger Federer Grammy-winner Dua Lipa Finally, there is Vogue's Anna Wintour (who needs no introduction) running the whole thing as usual. So what do co-chairs actually do ? It's a mix of helping put together the exclusive guest list, working with top chefs to create a specific menu (often aligned with the annual theme) and creating an atmosphere inside the event by selecting specific decor. Plus, there's the traditional hosting element, with co-chairs often taking the stage to perform during the dinner portion of the evening. Phones are strictly off limits, so sadly we never get to see any performances or interior design choices.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Vogue editor Anna Wintour has arrived
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: And she's walking the steps of the Met with actor Bill Nighy.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: No, Kim Kardashian hasn't been banned from the Met Gala
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Since the Met is invite-only, it's only when guests walk the red carpet that we know who made the cut. This year, there will be roughly 400 guests — similar to recent years but still lower than pre-pandemic highs of 500-600. As always, Anna Wintour and her team still get to approve every guest. Back in March, gossip tabloid Page Six reported that in Wintour's bid to narrow the guest list, the entire Kardashian clan had been culled. But it looks like the rumours were false, as Kim Kardashian posted these photos with Karl Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette, after spending some time at his office to "get inspiration" ahead of the event. Personally, I predict we'll spot Kendall Jenner (she was featured on Vogue's May cover which paid tribute to Lagerfeld) and I hope and pray Kylie Jenner will debut her relationship with Timothée Chalamet because that would be INTERESTING.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: How to watch the Met Gala red carpet arrivals
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: You can watch the whole shebang on the Vogue live stream below, which is due to go live in about 30 minutes.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Why the Met's decision to honour Karl Lagerfeld is controversial
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: This year's theme centers on the late designer Karl Lagerfeld, who made an indelible mark on luxury fashion in his long career at Chanel, Fendi and elsewhere. He was also a self-proclaimed "big mouth," publicly sounding off with fatphobia. He spoke against gay men who want to adopt children, migrants, sexual assault survivors, the #MeToo movement and "ugly" people, without apology. "He offended people right and left, making as much of an art out of the cutting aside as the perfectly cut double-face gown," New York Times fashion critic Vanessa Friedman wrote soon after Lagerfeld's death. "He judged," Friedman wrote, "and knew he would be judged himself, but he didn't care. Rather, he embraced it." The choice of Lagerfeld for fashion's biggest night is not without critics. At the time of the announcement, actor and activist Jameela Jamil acknowledge his fashion genius but denounce his "distinctly hateful" remarks, often toward women. "Why is THIS who we celebrate when there are so many AMAZING designers out there who aren't bigoted white men?" Jamil wrote. According to the Met, Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty, will look at "the designer's stylistic vocabulary as expressed in aesthetic themes that appear time and again in his fashions from the 1950s to his final collection in 2019." Lagerfeld died in 2019 at the age of 85.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Welcome to the 2023 Met Gala
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: The time has come! Fashion's biggest night is HERE. I'm Jessica Riga and I am so stoked to be bringing you all the glitz, glamour and celebrity moments from the red carpet of the Met Gala. It's also the first time in two years the Met Gala has returned to its traditional date — the first Monday in May (well, Tuesday for us.) I want to hear what you think of what everyone is wearing, so sound off in the comments, smash those reactions and let's get this fashion extravaganza underway!

what was this years theme
 - Peggy. Hi Peggy! This year's event is all about the late fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld. Given his past comments about women's bodies, the #MeToo movement and the Syrian refugee crisis, the event's theme is not without its critics. You can read more in this piece from my colleague Dannielle Maguire .

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The WNBA star was released in a high-level prisoner exchange for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout in December. Griner was detained in February last year after arriving in Russia with vape cartridges filled with "hashish oil", and was later found guilty of drug possession and smuggling. She's among a number of athletes attending tonight's invite-only event, and is there with her wife, Cherelle Griner.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It's not really about how much a ticket costs, because even celebrities can't just buy a ticket. The Met Gala is so exclusive that you have to be invited. Generally companies buy tables. A fashion label would then host its desired celebrities. This year, the cost has gone up, as it does every few years because even the Met isn't immune to inflation: It's now $50,000 for an individual ticket, and tables start at $300,000 .

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: This year's five hosts are drawn from television, film, sports and music, including: Emmy-winning writer, actor and producer Michaela Coel Oscar-winning actor Penélope Cruz, who has worked with Chanel for more than 20 years recently retired tennis superstar Roger Federer Grammy-winner Dua Lipa Finally, there is Vogue's Anna Wintour (who needs no introduction) running the whole thing as usual. So what do co-chairs actually do ? It's a mix of helping put together the exclusive guest list, working with top chefs to create a specific menu (often aligned with the annual theme) and creating an atmosphere inside the event by selecting specific decor. Plus, there's the traditional hosting element, with co-chairs often taking the stage to perform during the dinner portion of the evening. Phones are strictly off limits, so sadly we never get to see any performances or interior design choices.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Since the Met is invite-only, it's only when guests walk the red carpet that we know who made the cut. This year, there will be roughly 400 guests — similar to recent years but still lower than pre-pandemic highs of 500-600. As always, Anna Wintour and her team still get to approve every guest. Back in March, gossip tabloid Page Six reported that in Wintour's bid to narrow the guest list, the entire Kardashian clan had been culled. But it looks like the rumours were false, as Kim Kardashian posted these photos with Karl Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette, after spending some time at his office to "get inspiration" ahead of the event. Personally, I predict we'll spot Kendall Jenner (she was featured on Vogue's May cover which paid tribute to Lagerfeld) and I hope and pray Kylie Jenner will debut her relationship with Timothée Chalamet because that would be INTERESTING.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: This year's theme centers on the late designer Karl Lagerfeld, who made an indelible mark on luxury fashion in his long career at Chanel, Fendi and elsewhere. He was also a self-proclaimed "big mouth," publicly sounding off with fatphobia. He spoke against gay men who want to adopt children, migrants, sexual assault survivors, the #MeToo movement and "ugly" people, without apology. "He offended people right and left, making as much of an art out of the cutting aside as the perfectly cut double-face gown," New York Times fashion critic Vanessa Friedman wrote soon after Lagerfeld's death. "He judged," Friedman wrote, "and knew he would be judged himself, but he didn't care. Rather, he embraced it." The choice of Lagerfeld for fashion's biggest night is not without critics. At the time of the announcement, actor and activist Jameela Jamil acknowledge his fashion genius but denounce his "distinctly hateful" remarks, often toward women. "Why is THIS who we celebrate when there are so many AMAZING designers out there who aren't bigoted white men?" Jamil wrote. According to the Met, Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty, will look at "the designer's stylistic vocabulary as expressed in aesthetic themes that appear time and again in his fashions from the 1950s to his final collection in 2019." Lagerfeld died in 2019 at the age of 85.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Why the Met's decision to honour Karl Lagerfeld is controversial

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The time has come! Fashion's biggest night is HERE. I'm Jessica Riga and I am so stoked to be bringing you all the glitz, glamour and celebrity moments from the red carpet of the Met Gala. It's also the first time in two years the Met Gala has returned to its traditional date — the first Monday in May (well, Tuesday for us.) I want to hear what you think of what everyone is wearing, so sound off in the comments, smash those reactions and let's get this fashion extravaganza underway!

items.synopsis: The federal budget will contain targeted support for unemployed women over the age of 55, but the treasurer will not say if that will come in the form of a lift in the JobSeeker rate for that group.

items.synopsis: Rachel Lehmann Ware and her husband, Duncan, made a chaotic escape from Ukraine with their three cats after the Russian invasion last year. Now the Tasmanian teachers have returned to Kyiv, where lessons are often taught in an air raid shelter.

title.children: 'You could tell where the Russians had been': These Australians returned to Ukraine to help the country rebuild

image.altText: A chef holds up plates of food.

image.altText: Two women sit beside each other on a bench. One woman has her arm around the other's shoulders.

title.children: Family of man shot dead by police question why they weren't called in to help

image.altText: A sign sits outside Launceston General Hospital.

items.synopsis: A coroner lashes the Launceston General Hospital for not following its procedures and causing delays in diagnosing a baby's bowel obstruction, saying it was the "difference between her survival and death".
